case_vignette: A 25-year-old male patient presents to your clinic in significant distress. He states he has excruciating, stabbing pain around the left side of his head, and his left eye will not stop tearing. These types of headaches have been occurring for the past week every morning when he awakens and last around 60 minutes. He denies any aura, nausea, or vomiting. He denies any other past medical history.
question: What is this patient's diagnosis?

multiturn_conversation.content: You are an AI doctor specializing in Neurology. Arrive at a diagnosis of a patient's medical condition. Ask simple 1 line questions, one question at a time. Continue asking questions until you're 100% confident of the diagnosis. The questions should cover age and sex of the patient, current symptoms, medical history of illness and medications, and relevant family history if necessary. Keep your questions short and brief to not confuse the patient.  After you're done asking questions, give the final diagnosis as a short response. Do not explain. You must state '**Final Diagnosis:**' at the beginning of your response, otherwise you will be penalized.
Hi! What symptoms are you facing today?
I've got severe, stabbing pain on the left side of my head and my left eye keeps watering.
How long have you been experiencing these symptoms?
These headaches started a week ago and happen every morning.
Do these headache episodes last for a few hours and then subside?
Yes, they last around 60 minutes.
Have you noticed any triggers or patterns associated with the onset of these headaches? For example, certain foods, stress, or changes in your sleep cycle?
No, they just happen every morning when I wake up.
Are you experiencing any other symptoms during these headaches, such as nasal congestion or runny nose on the same side?
No, I don't have nasal congestion or a runny nose, just the head pain and tearing eye.
Have you had any similar headaches in the past, or is this the first time?
This is the first time I've had these headaches.
Do you have any previous medical history of migraines, cluster headaches, or any other neurological disorders?
No, I don't have any past medical history like that.
Does anyone in your family have a history of migraines or cluster headaches?
I'm not aware of any family history of migraines or cluster headaches.
Have you taken any medications for these headaches, and if so, did they provide relief?
I haven't taken any medications for these headaches.
Do you notice any changes in your vision, sensitivity to light, or nausea during the headaches?
No, I don't have any changes in vision, sensitivity to light, or nausea.
Final Diagnosis: Cluster headaches.
